material.mattext: Encrypted files can be transmitted in both electronic form and as written messages.
A hash value is a variable-length string of symbols and numbers representing the original input’s contents.
The standardization of cryptographic protocols discourages attackers from trying to break them.
Because IPsec Security Associations are bidirectional, only one need be established between two parties.
In a passive attack, cryptanalysts eavesdrop on transmissions but don’t interact with parties exchanging information.
To determine best path, routers use metrics such as the value of the first octet of the destination IP address.
A rollover cable is wired similarly to an Ethernet cable except that pins 7 and 8 are crossed.
Current Microsoft OSs include IPv6, but to use it, you must enable it first.
Cisco routers support both numbered and named ACLs, starting with IOS version 11.2.
Some methods of attacking a Cisco router do not require knowledge of the IOS version, so software patching is recommended.
All devices interpret attack signatures uniformly.
An atomic attack is a barrage of hundreds of packets directed at a host.
The signature of a normal FTP connection includes a three-way handshake.
Newer Trojans listen at a predetermined port on the target computer so that detection is more difficult.
Packet fragmentation is not normal, and can only occur if an attack has been initiated.
The Transport layer of the OSI model includes the RIP protocol.
The IP address 172.20.1.5 is a private IP address.
Fragmentation of IP packets is normal and doesn’t present any networking problems.
The TCP protocol uses a three-way handshake to create a connection.
IPv4 and IPv6 headers are interoperable.
A packet monkey is an unskilled programmer who spreads viruses and other malicious scripts to exploit computer weaknesses.
A worm creates files that copy themselves repeatedly and consume disk space.
Physical security protects a system from theft, fire, or environmental disaster.
Reviewing log files is a time-consuming task and therefore should only be done when an attack on the network has occurred.
With discretionary access control, network users can share information with other users, making it more risky than MAC.
Which of the following is NOT a critical goal of information security?
Which of the following is true about cryptographic primitives?
a single primitive makes up an entire cryptographic protocol
primitives are usually not the source of security failures
a primitive that provides confidentiality usually also provides authentication
Which type of function is used in cryptography?
Which of the following best describes a one-way function?
a bit string that prevents generation of the same ciphertext
random bits used as input for key derivation functions
generates secret keys from a secret value
easy to compute but difficult and time-consuming to reverse
Which of the following is true about PRNGs?
their state is measured in bytes
the shorter the state, the longer the period
they can never produce the same value
A hactivist can best be described as which of the following?
an unskilled programmer that spreads malicious scripts
use DoS attacks on Web sites with which they disagree
deface Web sites by leaving messages for their friends to read
Malware that creates networks of infected computers that can be controlled from a central station is referred to as which of the following?
What is a program that appears to do something useful but is actually malware?
Which of the following is a type of script that automates repetitive tasks in an application such as a word processor but can also be programmed to be a virus?
Which term is best described as an attack that relies on the gullibility of people?
In which OSI model layer will you find the OSPF protocol?
Which protocol is responsible for automatic assignment of IP addresses?
How are the two parts of an IP address determined?
Which of the following addresses is a Class B IP address?
Which of the following is NOT a reason for subnetting a network?
How does the CVE standard make network security devices and tools more effective?
the layered approach makes attacks nearly impossible
they can share information about attack signatures
it requires you to use compatible devices from one vendor
it warns an attacker that your site is being monitored
Which of the following is NOT among the items of information that a CVE reference reports?
Which of the following is an accurate set of characteristics you would find in an attack signature?
IP address, attacker’s alias, UDP options
protocol options, TCP ports, region of origin
IP address, TCP flags, port numbers
IP number, MAC address, TCP options
What is the term used when an IDPS doesn’t recognize that an attack is underway?
Which of the following is NOT a category of suspicious TCP/IP packet?
Which of the following types of traffic does NOT travel through routers?
Which of the following is a metric routers can use to determine best path?
What is contained in ARP tables?
To what type of port on a Cisco router do you connect a rollover cable?
Which of the following is NOT a type of entry found in a routing table?
A ______________ is made up of IP numbers and options, TCP flags, and port number that define a type of network activity.
The _______________ part of a packet is the actual data sent from an application on one computer to an application on another.
In the three-way handshake, the first packet in the sequence has the ________ flag set.
A TCP packet with no flags set is referred to as a _________ packet.
In an RPC _________, a targeted host receives an RPC set request from a source IP address of 127.0.0.1.
During the routing process, the router strips off ______________________ layer header information and then examines the Network layer address.
An ARP broadcast is sent to the local subnet in an attempt to discover the destination computer’s ______________ address.
____________ routes are manually configured routes that direct all packets not specifically configured in the routing table.
Rather than using classful routing, ________________ subnet masks allow you to divide your network into different sizes to make better use of available addresses.
The enable ___________ password uses type 5 encryption and overrides the enable password.
______________________ is achieved when neither party can plausibly deny its participation in message exchanges.
A ______________ value is a fixed-size string representing the original input’s contents.
A ________________ occurs when computing the MD5 algorithm with two different initialization vectors produces the same hash value.
Digital ____________________ security vulnerabilities are mostly associated with the IT infrastructure required to support interoperability.
______________ cryptanalysis is applicable to block ciphers that use a substitution-permutation network including Rijndael, Twofish, and IDEA.
DNS operates at the _________________ layer of the OSI model.
The ______________________ is the part of the IP address that is the same among computers in a network segment.
The _____________ field in an IP header is a 3-bit value indicating whether a datagram is a fragment.
________________ IPv6 addresses are used for one-to-one or one-to-many communication.
The ____________ command shows current sessions with associated port numbers.
__________________ are spread by several methods, including running executable code, sharing disks or memory sticks, opening e-mail attachments, and viewing infected or malicious Web pages.
______________ do not require user intervention to be launched; they are self-propagating.
A ______________ is reserved for a program that runs in the background to listen for requests for the service it offers.
______________________ is the capability to prevent a participant in an electronic transaction from denying that it performed an action.
________________ events usually track the operations of the firewall or IDPS, making a log entry whenever it starts or shuts down.
